title: Vermillion
description: A realistic VR oil painting studio with tools, color mixing, and lifelike canvas textures.
educational: Great for art classes to explore painting techniques, color theory, and digital studio practice.

title: Open Brush
description: An open-source continuation of Google’s Tilt Brush, allowing 3D brush strokes in space.
educational: Useful for teaching spatial art, VR creativity, and immersive design projects.

title: Painting VR
description: A hands-on VR painting workshop with large-scale canvases and customizable tools.
educational: Allows students to practice painting techniques without materials or mess.

title: Kingspray Graffiti
description: A VR graffiti simulator with realistic spray paint effects and urban backdrops.
educational: Lets students explore street art safely while discussing art history, culture, and expression.

title: SculptrVR
description: A beginner-friendly VR sculpting and voxel modeling tool for creating 3D objects.
educational: Good for introducing students to 3D design, modeling concepts, and creative prototyping.

title: Gravity Sketch
description: A professional 3D design tool for sketching, modeling, and prototyping in VR.
educational: Excellent for design, architecture, and engineering students to collaborate on 3D projects.

title: ShapesXR
description: A collaborative VR prototyping tool for UI/UX and spatial design.
educational: Useful in computer science and design programs for testing user interfaces and team collaboration.

title: Arkio
description: A VR architectural design and planning tool with real-time collaboration.
educational: Architecture students can model buildings, test layouts, and visualize space in VR.

title: Figmin XR
description: A mixed reality creative app for building, animating, and interacting with 3D art.
educational: Encourages students to blend VR and AR by creating interactive MR projects.

title: Nanome
description: A molecular visualization and simulation workspace for exploring proteins, drugs, and materials in VR.
educational: Ideal for chemistry/biology courses to visualize molecular structures and discuss binding or interactions.

title: Sharecare YOU: Anatomy
description: A detailed human anatomy explorer with layered systems and guided lessons.
educational: Great for anatomy and physiology to examine organs, systems, and clinical context in 3D.

title: The Body VR: Journey Inside a Cell
description: A guided trip through the bloodstream and inside a human cell to see cellular processes up close.
educational: Use to introduce cell biology concepts and systems-level thinking with memorable visuals.

title: 3D Organon VR Anatomy (XR Premium)
description: A comprehensive VR anatomy atlas with labeled models, quizzes, and teaching tools.
educational: Supports anatomy labs, self-study, and instructor-led demonstrations with layered system views.

title: Mission: ISS
description: An interactive tour of the International Space Station with tasks and narrated segments.
educational: Great for space science and engineering—connects concepts to real-world habitats and systems.

title: Titans of Space PLUS
description: A guided tour of the solar system comparing planetary sizes, distances, and features.
educational: Perfect for astronomy lessons to reinforce scale, orbits, and planetary science concepts.

title: Apollo 11 VR
description: A cinematic VR recreation of the Apollo 11 mission from pre-launch to moon landing.
educational: Use in history and science to discuss the space race, teamwork, and engineering breakthroughs.

title: Ocean Rift
description: An underwater safari with diverse marine habitats and animal encounters.
educational: Supports biology/ecology lessons on biomes, adaptations, and conservation.

title: Blueplanet VR Explore
description: A collection of photogrammetry sites and landscapes from around the world.
educational: Great for geography, geology, and cultural studies; discuss terrain, history, and preservation.

title: Anne Frank House VR
description: A respectful VR tour of the Secret Annex with historical narration and context.
educational: Facilitates discussions on WWII, tolerance, and human rights with immersive perspective.

title: Wander
description: A Street View-style world explorer for visiting real locations in VR.
educational: Use for virtual field trips, place-based learning, and cultural geography.

title: Mondly: Languages in VR
description: Language learning scenarios with speech recognition and conversational practice.
educational: Supports ESL and language courses with immersive speaking and listening practice.

title: Immerse — Learn Languages in VR
description: Live instructor-led language sessions and social practice environments.
educational: Good for conversational fluency and cultural role-play activities in class.

title: ENGAGE XR
description: A virtual events and education platform for hosting classes, talks, and interactive lessons.
educational: Useful for remote lectures, guest speakers, and multi-class collaborations in VR.

title: Spatial
description: A social 3D platform for exhibits, events, and community spaces.
educational: Host student showcases, poster sessions, and interactive galleries.

title: Immersed
description: A virtual productivity workspace with multi-monitor streaming and team rooms.
educational: Great for focus sessions, research, and remote group work in quiet VR spaces.

title: TRIPP
description: Guided mindfulness and relaxation experiences with visuals and breath cues.
educational: Supports stress management, short wellness breaks, and mental health initiatives on campus.

title: Energy Encyclopedia VR
description: An interactive VR exhibit of energy systems with detailed, technically accurate 3D models. Explore 20+ animated cross-sections and visit life-size power plant sites (fission, fusion, solar, hydro, wind).
educational: Use for STEM/engineering lessons to compare generation methods, efficiency, safety, and environmental impact; run virtual field trips and system walkthroughs.
notes: Free on Meta Quest; consider preloading assets; great for instructor-led tours.

title: Ovation
tags: Public Speaking, Presentation, Soft Skills, AI Feedback
description: A VR public-speaking trainer where you present to realistic AI avatars and receive AI-generated feedback on delivery.
educational: Use for speech and communications courses to practice presentations, interviews, and Q&A—reinforce pacing, eye contact, filler words, and confidence with repeatable scenarios.
notes: Headset mic recommended; advanced features require a subscription.

title: Wooorld
tags: Geography, Maps, Mixed Reality, Field Trips, Collaboration
description: A mixed-reality 3D world map with Google-Earth-style terrain and buildings, street imagery, and multiplayer co-exploration right in your room.
educational: Run virtual field trips to cities and landmarks; discuss cultural/physical geography, urban planning, and landforms; use co-present exploration for place-based inquiry and presentations.
notes: Internet required; multiplayer sessions supported; consider preloading target locations for class.

title: Human Anatomy VR
description: A comprehensive VR anatomy atlas with labeled 3D models across major body systems, micro-anatomy views, and powerful search/navigation for close-up study.
educational: Use in A&P to demonstrate organs and systems, support identification practice, and facilitate instructor-led walk-throughs of structure and function.
notes: Standalone app; seated/standing/room-scale; institutional edition available; ~1.2 GB download.

title: Cosmic XR - Space In Your Room
tags: Astronomy, Mixed Reality, Space, Planets, Hand Tracking
description: A mixed-reality space atlas that brings the solar system, galaxies, and black holes into your room with natural hand interactions.
educational: Use for astronomy/Earth science to demonstrate scale, motion, and comparative planetology; run MR ‘in-room’ field trips and student presentations.
notes: Supports hand tracking and passthrough MR; designed for Quest 2/3/3S/Pro; allow clear floor space for in-room exploration.

title: Bodyswaps - Soft Skills Training
department: Communications, Business, Career Services, Health Science
tags: Soft Skills, Communication, Interview, Leadership, Role-play, AI Feedback
description: AI-powered VR simulations where learners practice with virtual humans and receive personalized feedback across communication, employability, leadership, and EDI scenarios.
educational: Use for public speaking and interview practice in communications/career courses; run role-plays for empathy and patient communication in health science; debrief with feedback to build reflective practice.
notes: Institutional licensing/subscription; free demo available; headset mic recommended; internet required for online features.

title: IMMERROCK
tags: Music, Guitar, Mixed Reality, Practice, Note Detection
description: A mixed-reality guitar trainer that overlays chords, tabs, and guidance onto your real instrument, with bite-sized exercises and real-time accuracy feedback.
educational: Great for applied music: scaffold chord changes, rhythm, scales, and sight-reading; use progress-based practice for formative assessment and individual skill building.
notes: Requires a real guitar; passthrough MR with on-device note detection; recommend quiet room and proper strap/stance for longer sessions.

title: Warship Mars
description: A VR diving expedition to the 1564 wreck of the Swedish flagship Mars, built from high-detail photogrammetry. Explore the site underwater, document finds, then analyze them in a virtual research space.
educational: Great for history/archaeology units: run a virtual field trip, practice evidence collection, and discuss maritime technology, conflict, and preservation ethics.
notes: Free on Quest; includes Diving and Researcher modes; internet required for download.

title: Titanic VR
tags: History, Maritime Archaeology, Submarine, ROV, Exploration
description: A diving simulator and immersive interactive story at the RMS Titanic wreck site—pilot a submersible and ROV, survey the debris field, and experience cinematic historical sequences.
educational: Use for history/archaeology units to discuss evidence gathering, preservation ethics, maritime technology, and primary-source interpretation via virtual fieldwork.
notes: Single-player; includes exploration missions and story content; over 6 hours of content; consider content sensitivity for some learners.

title: Geo Voyage
tags: Geography, Mixed Reality, Maps, AI Agent, Google Maps
description: A mixed-reality learning app that turns your room into a globe you can explore—drop a pin and jump from a spatial map into an immersive view, guided by an AI learning agent.
educational: Use for virtual field trips and place-based inquiry. Compare regions, landmarks, and human/physical geography; leverage the AI guide for Q&A, definitions, and research prompts.
notes: Built with Meta Spatial SDK; integrates Llama 3 + Wit.AI and Google Maps API for MR→VR transitions; internet required for AI/map features.

title: MLK: Now is the Time
tags: Civil Rights, History, VR Film, Interactive, March on Washington
description: An immersive interpretation of Dr. King’s “I Have a Dream” speech that explores ongoing inequities through first-person stories and interactive scenes.
educational: Use for civil rights and U.S. history units to connect 1963 to today—facilitate reflection on housing, voting, and policing; prompt discussion, journaling, and source analysis.
notes: Free on Quest; audio excerpts from the speech; preview mature themes and plan a guided debrief.

title: JFK Memento: The Immersive Documentary
description: A ~40-minute immersive VR documentary that revisits November 22, 1963 and the investigation that followed, blending narration with archival films and photos remastered in 3D and projected onto historic sites.
educational: Use in U.S. history/civics to analyze primary sources and media; discuss historical context, eyewitness narratives, and how evidence is presented. Ideal for guided viewing with reflection prompts.
notes: Appears on the Meta Store as “Inside History: The JFK Assassination” (by TARGO). Family-appropriate presentation with no graphic depictions; consider content sensitivity and plan a debrief.
